original: Berner, Christian, generalkonsui, Göteborg, f. 19/1/77 i Ålesund, Norge, av härihövd. Mörten Fridthjof B. o. Marie Josepha Schive. G. 06 m. Isoide Margadant. Barn: Fridthjof f. 07, civring., v. verkst. dir. i Christian Berner A-B, Soilvedg 10, g. m. köpm. Gunnar Wictors, Gbg, Erling 12, civ:ing,, verkst. dir. i Isoler. A-B WMB, Arne 15, civiekon., chef f. Chr. Berners A-B avd:kont. i Sthlm, Inger-Johanne 17, g. m. lantmäst. Birger Isacson, Luleå, Sten 26. — Start, grossh ifirma i Gbg 97 i art. o. mask. f. brygg. o. vatten-fabr. samt isoler., ’sen. äv. mask. f. pappers- o. celluilo’saind. isamt mejerier. Avdikont. i Sthlm, Malmö, Oslo, Helsingfors, Köpenhamn. Fr. 47 ombild. t. Christian Berner A-B. Gen ikons, f. Tjeckoslov. sed. 35. Ordf. i styr. f. Christian Berner A-B, Gbg, A-B
translated: Berner, Christian, consul general, Gothenburg, b. 19/1/77 in Ålesund, Norway, of noble descent. Son of Morten Fridthjof B. and Marie Josepha Schive. Married in 1906 to Isoide Margadant. Children: Fridthjof b. 1907, civil engineer, executive director in Christian Berner A-B, Soilvedg 10, married to merchant Gunnar Wictors, Gothenburg; Erling b. 1912, civil engineer, executive director in Isoler. A-B WMB; Arne b. 1915, bachelor of economics, head of the Chr. Berners A-B division office in Stockholm; Inger-Johanne b. 1917, married to agronomist Birger Isacson, Luleå; Sten b. 1926. — Started wholesale firm in Gothenburg in 1897 for art and machinery for breweries and water factories as well as insulation, later also machinery for paper and cellulose industry as well as dairies. Branch offices in Stockholm, Malmö, Oslo, Helsinki, Copenhagen. Converted to Christian Berner A-B in 1947. Consul general for Czechoslovakia since 1935. Chairman of the board for Christian Berner A-B, Gothenburg, A-B.

structured.name: Christian Berner
structured.description: Christian Berner was a Swedish consul general and founding member of Christian Berner A-B.
